conclusion: Determine the change in magnetic flux by calculating initial and final fluxes and finding their difference.
The initial orientation of the coil is such that the normal to the coil is along the positive y-axis.
The magnetic field B is along the positive x-axis.
The angle between the magnetic field and the normal to the coil is 90°.
The initial magnetic flux Φi is calculated as 0 Wb using Φi = B * A * cos(θ) with θ = 90°.
After rotating the coil by 60° downward around the z-axis, the normal to the coil makes an angle of 60° with the positive y-axis.
The angle between the magnetic field and the normal to the coil is now 30°.
The final magnetic flux Φf is calculated as 0.02√3 Wb using Φf = B * A * cos(θ) with θ = 30°.
The change in magnetic flux ΔΦ is calculated as 0.02√3 Wb.
The change in magnetic flux passing through the coil is 0.02√3 Wb.
